headline: Sausage Casserole
description: This sausage casserole features shredded potatoes and onions baked with eggs, sausage, cottage cheese, and Cheddar for a family-favorite breakfast.

video.description: See how to make a top-rated breakfast casserole.
video.name: Sausage Casserole

name: Sausage Casserole
recipeIngredient: 3 cups shredded potatoes, drained and pressed
1 (16 ounce) container small curd cottage cheese

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Heat a large, deep skillet over medium-high heat. Cook sausage in the hot skillet until evenly browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and discard grease.

Stir together shredded potatoes and butter in the prepared baking dish; lightly press mixture into the bottom and sides of the dish. Mix together sausage, cottage cheese, Cheddar cheese, onion, and eggs in a bowl. Pour over potato mixture.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of casserole comes out clean, about 1 hour. Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: 8 eggs and some dijon mustard! Yum. Used a little less cheese cause that's what I had,

I’ve made this recipe dozens of times over the years. In my family, we call it “The Crowd Pleaser”! I always cook the onions with the sausage, and sometimes I sub out half the cottage cheese for (not quite all of) a can of cream of onion soup. Delicious, no matter how you make it!

Because there are just two of us I cut the recipe in half and used a 8x8 Pyrex dish which I sprayed first. I used hot Jimmy Dean sausage and added some diced red bell pepper and white onion cooked along with the sausage. I used fresh grated sharp cheddar cheese and Daisy 4% cottage cheese. I had a package of Simply Potatoe hash browns that I used with the melted butter in the bottom of the dish pressed down. I also added a small can of Ortega mild chilies. Three normal size eggs and only cooked the smaller size for 45 minutes. I served it with a cup of fresh chopped fruit and homemade banana nut bread. This would be good for either dinner or breakfast and I will definitely make it again.
Very easy recipe. Tasted great, too.

This is a delicious recipe as-is, but I love how versatile this recipe is. We have chickens and often have more eggs than we know what to do with, and it is an easy way to use lots of eggs quickly. I usually double the number of eggs. It makes it go farther. I use the cubed hash browns sometimes, and I almost always add more hash browns, because there aren't enough to go up the sides of my casserole dish at 3 cups. I'll do 4-5 cups and just pour the butter over them in the casserole dish. I didn't have enough cottage cheese today and did half cottage cheese and half sour cream. That actually worked really well. You can add mushrooms, diced green chiles or rotel, spicy cheeses, etc. to give it a different type of deliciousness. If you double the eggs, just add a bit more of everything else... doesn't need to be precise measurements, but if you like precise measurements, just 1.5 everything else. Great recipe!
I omitted the onions because they upset my stomach. It was really good.

I made this pretty much as written, but I did add a few items because I wanted to use them up. I added some frozen chopped spinach, I used the real potatoes as written, and I added some poblano pepper. I did also salt the potatoes and salt and pepper the egg mixture. Delicious! This will be my work breakfast for the next week.
Very good recipe, I pretty much followed the same directions. I didn't need to measure.
Delicious

I made this for a "breakfast for dinner" concept. It was a hit! Will definitely make again with a few alterations to our preferences. 
I did use 8 eggs instead of 6 as mentioned. I also used frozen hashbrowns, because why not! We did not prebake. We cooked onion with the sausage (white onion with ground sausage). 
Used probably closer to 16oz of mixed cheeses for a little zing. 
It turned out wonderful. Next time we will add more sausage as I think it needs another 1/2lb and it could be a bit creamier. Maybe more cottage cheese or sour cream?

This was a winner Christmas morning breakfast! I used a bag of hash browns, dusted that with garlic powder, used 7 eggs, and added salt and pepper to the mixture. I think next time I’ll try ground sausage instead of links. So easy to put together and everyone loved it.

This casserole turned out great! I read the other reviews and made some suggested changes. I used 8 eggs instead of 6, 3/4 cup of onion which I cooked along with the sausage. My sausage came from a butcher and didn't list all the spices so I added 2 cloves of garlic, sprinkled some sage powder and salt while cooking. I think I ended up shredding closer to 14 oz of mild cheddar cheese, but since when to people complain of too much cheese? I know I don't.
I followed your instructions to the letter. Except a touch more cheddar cheese and onions. It turned our great. We will be adding this recipe to our repeat often list. Thanks for sharing it.
Excellent -- perfect for a crowd, the cottage cheese completely hides in this dish (for the picky eaters in the fam who don't like cottage cheese).

Could find my mother-in-law’s recipe, so decided to try this one that looked really similar. Amazing!!! Made a couple changes..can’t stand cottage cheese, so sub’d cream of chicken soup (was thinking like a cheesy potato egg bake), which added awesome flavor!! Also sautéed leeks with the turkey sausage, and added some red pepper flakes to give it a little kick. We were so happy with how it turned out, felt like even a little more flavorful than my MIL’s (sorry Denise)! :)
Quick and easy! One of easiest casseroles to make.

I prepared this meal for my wife’s birthday breakfast and she loved it. I was a little nervous initially so I followed the directions exactly. The next time I prepare this meal I’ll add some other ingredients to enhance the flavor.
Loved it, just like it was written. EZ an delicous!

It’s a decent recipe, but it needs flavor. I added salt and pepper to the potatoes (I used unsalted butter to mix with the potatoes, as it’s all I had). If using frozen shredded potatoes, be aware that they will turn into more of a mashed potato when forming the crust and pressing moisture out. I also recommend more potatoes.
My family loves this casserole. I use 8 eggs and add mushrooms. Truly delicious
Made in 2 pie pans.

I lined pan with torn whole wheat tortillas after buttering it. Then lightly brushed butter on the tortillas. I cooked the onion with the sausage for a few minutes. I also substituted 3/4 cup sour cream for cottage cheese. Added black pepper, red pepper flakes & dried parsley. Dotted top with a few tiny tomatoes & sprinkled lightly with paprika. Only needed to cook 50 minutes. Wonderful!
Love this recipe!! 💙
I used o'Brien hash browns with onion and green peppers as well as 2 extra eggs
This recipe was very tasty just as is. Just be aware that it takes an hour to bake!
Great recipe. Prep time is easy good for a Sunday brunch. Reheats nicely. One of my favorites. Followed the recipe to the letter.?

My kids liked it, which is always good. It definitely needs seasoning, like salt in the potatoes, pepper, and onion powder overall. Not crazy about the texture. I’ll brown the potatoes first and try ricotta instead of cottage cheese next time.

This casserole was soooo good! Making the buttery hashbrown nest was such a treat to bite in the crunchy goodness. I used 9 large eggs since no one has jumbo eggs sitting in the fridge. I cooked my onions with my sausage to get them soft and flavorful. I used Jimmy Dean sausage because I had it. I salted the potatoes and I salted the egg mixture before baking. Definitely add salt. Next time I am going to add green chilis. Delish!

My family and I wanted to love this casserole on Christmas morning, but it tasted like bland mashed potatoes with sausage mixed in. Not very good. Recommend baking/browning the hash browns on the bottom of the bowl before adding other ingredients.
This is a family favorite and my go to for a quick and easy egg casserole!
Very good-made it ahead for Christmas breakfast. Very creamy and delicious. I used turkey sausage but made the recipe as directed except my ovens run hot so cooked it at 350 for 50 minutes.
I used H-E-B hot and spicy breakfast sausage and French fried potato rounds for the crust. Turned out amazing! My sister and I are going to make this for Christmas brunch. Cannot wait!
Followed the recipe only exception was cooked potatoes at 350 for a half hour then continued with recipe as written.

I used a 30oz bag of 'o'brien' style frozen potatoes (thawed) which I spread across the bottom and sides of the 9x13in pan and used a spoon to pour the melted butter over, then baked for 20 minutes alone. Also I substituted a can of condensed cream of mushroom soup & about 1/2 cup milk for the cottage cheese & increased the cheese by about 25% and then also sprinkled another half cup cheese across the top before baking. I also added a 6oz can of green chilis. After pre-baking the potatoes with butter I combined the other ingredients, spread over potatoes & baked for about 40 minutes; it was fluffy and cheesy & tasty but needed a little ketchup, the fam loved & I will make again.
I used Jimmy Dean precooked sausage links. Sauted the diced onion with sausage, diced the links. Used 3 cups of thawed hash brown potatoes could easily have used 4 cups.
So good - crowd pleaser!!! Thank you!!
Delish! I questioned the cottage cheese but this recipe is so yummy and easy. I added bell peppers and salt, pepper, and crushed red pepper. Will be making again!

I made this but I did a few things different. I used Tennessee Pride Mild Sausage and left out the 1/2 onion. I instead used southern-style hash browns that had onion and bell peppers in it. Additionally, I put some extra cheese on the top of the casserole (total I used 16 oz of cheese in my recipe).
Yes I made it and my family loved it. It was easy to make.

I enjoyed much. I did make some modifications to the original. I included breakfast sausage in combination with the bacon. I included a fourth & fifth(4th &5th) cheese and swapped out Cheddar for Monterrey Jack. The extra cheeses included are Mozzarella and Parmesan. Sprinkled the top with Old Bay and Spanish Smoked Paprika. All together is an awesome combination of flavors.
This was the best breakfast casserole I have ever made. I will be making it again for a baby shower.
This was the best breakfast casserole I have ha e ever made!

So good! I tossed some chopped green pepper in just because I needed to use it up, I didn’t have jumbo eggs so I used 8 large ones. I also pre-baked the crust but only for about 8 minutes. Will definitely make again.

So, when I first started making this, I stayed straight with the recipe, except for the sage sausage. However, in trying to eat a little healthier, I've started putting veggies in it. Still one of my favorite breakfast foods! The best recipe is the one you can tweek every now and then.

Hi... I have tried this by adding my twist of finely cut veggies. turned out to be very yummy and filling.
good recipe.
I used left over mashed potatoes as the base, came out awesome!
Excellent as written. Needed to use up some venison pan sausage and potatoes. Great basic recipe that can be tailored to your liking.
This soup is wonderful. I was given a lot of kales and didn’t know what to makes from it. I did add 1-2 cups of celery just because I add celery to most soups and used market
I followed recipe AS IS and it was delicious! The hash browns got crispy without pre-browning them as others suggested. The portions held up really well when removed fro
I used plant Based ground beef substitute. Fabulous
Really good

I've made this multiple times now. I've taken others' suggestions and added 2 additional eggs as well as another cup of frozen hash browns and baked the hash browns/butter combo for about 30 minutes. 
The last time, I also added some whipped cream cheese that I had in the fridge. Every time, it's been very good!
This bakes to a beautiful golden brown color and is absolutely delicious!!
Excellent recipe for a crowd. Great flavor.
It was amazing. This time I added sweet potatoes as well as regular Hashbrowns. Also added chopped red pepper. So easy and a great dish
A very good, easy to make breakfast casserole.
just made this and turned out awesome. I added some pre cooked bacon and ham to it and god it was so good. the whole family loved it even my picky 4 year old

Wow! This was great! I followed some of the suggestions and I will be making this again and again. I was eating it for dinner every night until it was gone. I did not pre cook the hash browns. I loved it.
The first time I made this the I used ricotta and used 8 eggs. It was a little dry but that may have been me overcooking it. I also cooked the potatoes first.
Great
Great

I used O'Brien potatoes instead of shredded potatoes, and didn't put in any other onion than what was with the O'Brien potatoes. This is a great recipe, and I will most certainly make it again. Perhaps with spicy sausage next time. I just used regular this time, and it was still very good.
Took it to our Sunday School breakfast. Everyone loved it.
Make this often!! Great flavor! I always add 1 extra egg.

First time I made it followed recipe exactly it was delicious but far to rich for our tastes. I now omit the butter and cottage cheese. Used sharp cheddar, bit of hot sauce. Occasionally I add cooked spinach. Recipe is quite versatile. Everyone really likes it and it’s great for leftovers makes for very fast and filling breakfast. Thank you for posting such a great recipe.

This is really good. Trying to figure out what was missing. Maybe top with hot sauce or ketchup. Don’t get me wrong, it is really good, but I think the ketchup or hot sauce would take it over the top. Great for a group. Love the cottage cheese. I cooked the sausage with a chopped onion and red bell pepper. Stored in the fridge overnight. Next day I greased a deep dish 9x13 and poured in a big bag of O’brien potatoes. In a separate bowl I beat 8 eggs and cream cheese. Then added sharp cheddar, and the sausage/onion/red pepper mix. Baked at 375 for an hour.

Made same changes as others suggested...8 eggs, pre-baked the potato crust @ 350 for 35 minutes, sauteed onions and red bell pepper with the sausage, sharp cheddar and added some red pepper flakes, salt and pepper. Turned out great

I made this with a few tweaks. First of all I used a ton of seasoning. Secondly I used 4 cups of frozen hash browns instead of 3. I seasoned the butter that you pour over them with chipotle seasoning, salt, pepper and garlic. I used 1/2 cup of cottage cheese and 1/2 cup of sour cream instead of all cottage cheese. i feel like some cream of mushroom soup would be delicious in this also. It was so good. Next time I will use more egg, and more veggies like peppers, spinach and maybe some tomatoes as well.

I have made this for a few years. It's an all around good recipe that always turns out good. Sometimes I add. some canned green chiles and a few shakes of your favorite hot sauce to the egg mixture. You can use different meats or none at all. It's a keeper.

This is my absolute top favorite for taking to work. I'll add an extra half pound to a pound of meat and I have found it better to mix the potatoes in with everything else and to split it between a 9X11 pan and a smaller square cake pan. It's not as thick but makes it stay together after freezing and re-heating instead of splitting into layers and falling apart.

Absolutely delicious! I did cut the recipe in half since there are only 2 of us. In a smaller pan, it was done in 30 mins. We both loved it and will definitely be making it again. Thanks for the great recipe!
Too much cheese, it was not good.
This was saved as a Favorite as it was so good
This was delicious the way the recipe is presented. It was a huge hit!! I made this twice but would next time brown the potatoes first but believe me it great as is!
It was truly Amazing, my kids and friends Loved it!!!!
I made this i will be making this Tomorrow

Well I screwed it up! I mixed the shredded potatoes together with everything else. But guess what? It was still DEEE-LISH! Ive made it both as per directions, as well as the 'mistake' way. I actually kind of preferred it all mixed together!

I've made this recipe many times. It's perfect for the weekends for my husband and I. We have so many places to be first thing in the morning on Saturdays and Sundays (swim meets, baseball games, basketball games). I can focus on getting the kids fed and ready and my husband and I can heat a slice of this up and take it to the game and have a delicious breakfast on the run. I have added chopped bell pepper and diced mushroom for variety. It's so Good! I also use 8 eggs and a bag of frozen shredded potatoes. Leftovers go great in my husbands lunch. He takes lunch around 10 am so it's a good meal (he works on a golf course). Its great to heat up after I get the kids off to school and Mama can sit back and enjoy :-)
Yeah this is a good breakfast recipe. Easy. I will make this again.

So good and so easy!! I like to mix ingredients he night before so I can just pop it in the oven. Turns out great, can also substitute riced cauliflower for the potatoes to keep it carb free. If I’m particularly lazy I’ll even but cubed ham to mix in instead of cooking sausage!

Moist and delicious! The only things I changed was adding an extra cup of frozen hash brown potatoes with a 1/2 cup of butter instead of a 1/4 cup (the extra butter makes it easier to form the shell). I also cooked the onions with the sausage....this is one of the best breakfast casseroles on this site!

Moist and delicious! The only things I changed was adding an extra cup of frozen hash brown potatoes with a 1/2 cup of butter instead of a 1/4 cup (the extra butter makes it easier to form the shell). I also cooked the onions with the sausage....this is one of the best breakfast casseroles on this site!
This was awesome! loved it!

Made for our church's Easter potluck this morning. Rave reviews! I followed other reviewer's comments by increasing to 8 eggs, using frozen hash browns, sautéing the sausage and onion together, melting the butter in the dish while pre-heating the oven, and then cooking the hash browns first for 30 minutes.

First I did as other reviewers and cooked the potatoes while I was frying the sausage. There wasn't nearly enough potatoes. Don't be tempted to add salt as the cheese and sausage give more than enough. This was very rich and somewhat greasy so I don't think I'll make it again. If I do, I will add a lot more potatoes.
Very good had a lot of compliments and it was fast to make and the house smelled delicious!

It really wasn’t that hard, and I’m new to cooking. I made this to help my wife cook less and she was so thankful. It’s not like, super amazing tasting because I didn’t use sausage with strong flavor. Next time I’ll make it with maple sausage like the recipe says!

Very good casserole! I served this as part of a 'Breakfast for Dinner' get together and everyone loved it! When I try new recipes I always have like, 5 bowls on my counter. This was no different but 3 are adequate! 
Bowl 1)
I used a large bag of Ore-Ida shredded hash browns (about 5 cups), I followed others suggestions and buttered 13x9 glass dish and spread hash browns into it and let set up in oven for about 15 minutes. Added garlic powder, salt, pepper
Bowl 2)
10 large eggs beaten, with salt and pepper to taste.( Biggest change because of large group.) 
Bowl 3)
I sauteed a freshly diced jalapeno with 1/4 cup purple onion with regular flavored pork sausage. Let it cool BEFORE adding to egg mixture! Fold into to hash brown dish. Took about 55 minutes to cook. The texture was beautiful, a little darker than I wanted, so I covered with foil for final minutes. Garnished with more shredded cheese(YES!) and served. LOVED by all 17 of my guests. Thanks for the recipe! No photos - it was gone!

Will definitely make this again. Thank you so much for a fantastic recipe! 

I had some cream cheese in my fridge I needed to use up, so I substituted the cottage cheese with 16 oz. of cream cheese - thinned a little with sour cream to get the same consistency. Next time I'm going to try the cottage cheese. I got some pre cut peppers and onions at the supermarket and sautéed them with the sausage. I also used the pre-shredded but not frozen hash browns - (like Simply Potatoes but used store brand instead) - and pre-baked the crust for 30 minutes. Topped it with cracker crumbs to keep the eggs really moist underneath and add some crunch.

I mixed this all up the night before because I'm trying to prep to meals on nights I have the time to cook. My family was raving about it served up with flaky layers biscuits.

Before making this I changed quite a few things and then served it to a group at church. It got rave reviews. I prepped what i could the day before, then mixed and baked the casseroles the day I served. I cooked the sausage and poured off most of the fat and chilled it. I cooked double the onion in the remaining sausage fat and chilled it. Next morning I measured out the fat and added butter needed and tossed with potato cubes and baked in greased pans while I mixed remaining ingredients, substituting sharp cheddar, 9 large eggs, and adding 1 1/2 teaspoons salt and 3/4 teaspoon pepper. Once in pan, I tossed well and baked. Even the kids were saying they loved it!
I liked it but next time I will season the potatoes and use spicy sausage. That will make it perfect for me.

Love this recipe, especially when traveling. No need to buy a bag of flour just for a half-cup, or a whole thing of spices just for a tablespoon. Everything here can be bought at the store with no leftover/extra ingredients (okay, maybe you can’t buy a half-stick of butter). It’s also extremely easy and feeds many. About to make it again, maybe my 10th time, and felt compelled to review it.
This was fantastic!! Definitely a keeper. Only sub I did was ground venison. Thanks!
Perfect as it is
I made it and it was delicious quick and easy good flavor.

LOVED THIS Dish!!!! 10 Stars!!!!
Husband loved it, and said it tasted like Quiche!
I followed the recipe as noted in the steps listed.
I did one check at 40 Minutes into it to see how it was doing.
It took 55 minutes to an hour to cook as well.
I did the "Toothpick Test" and the toothpick stood up straight.
Yes, waited the 5 minutes and then shared it with him.
Husband doesn't like onions, so I cut that amount in half and he said he couldn't taste it. So, it turned out wonderful.
Next time I try it, I might add broccoli, as that is a husband favorite too. And, boy, was this easy. I'm excited to have been so successful with this dish. Truly amazing. Thank you for your donation to Allrecipese.com !

This is now my go-to brunch recipe. I cook the sausage and onions on the stovetop first. I add eggs as the last ingredient to the mixture to give the sausage and onions a chance to cool before touching the eggs

I made a few of the changes as suggested by others but nothing drastic that I think changed the overall taste of the casserole (I increased potatoes to 4C, and baked the potato portion for 30mins before adding the egg mixture. I used maple sausage (and cooked onion with the sausage) and we loved it. I also used 8 extra large eggs.) Great recipe ... would be easy to modify based on individual taste.
I used 8 eggs, did a quick saute of the onions in the sausage skillet once the sausage was done. Delicious.
